title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2108.6 - Service and filing of protests
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2108.6 - Service and filing of protests

State Regulations
L. 1964, ch. 244
(a) Each protest shall be filed in an
original and one copy at the Division of Housing and Community Renewal, Office
of Rent Administration, 393 Seventh Avenue, New York 1, New York. (b) Where the protest is against an order
issued by the local rent administrator, a copy of the protest shall also be
served on the local rent administrator issuing the order being protested, and
upon each party affected by the protest. (c) A protest under section
2108.5
will not be accepted for
filing unless accompanied by an affidavit or other proof of such
service. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2108.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
